result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas J Meyers was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs $2116.00 less $750.00 cash bond posted.  Remainder to probation.  Submit DNA sample/$250.00 DNA Surcharge.

superMiscConds.notes: Not possess/consume alcohol.  Not go upon premises for on site consumption.

For Half-Priced Ignition Interlock Device filed by defendant.
Aug. 30, 2016 plea/sentencing hearing filed by Court Reporter Cathy Braunschweig
Ct 1 OWI 5/6th, Ct 2 OWI- BAC 5/6th.

ADA Troy Cross appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in person with Atty Sarah Schmeiser.  Amended Information filed- OWI 5/6th offense.  Rights/elements.     Guilty plea entered. Court accepts plea, adjudged guilty, JOC entered. Sentencing arguments.  Count 2 dismissed. Court imposed  5 years prison~2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, $2116 fine, 36 month revocation, 36 month IID upon licensure, AODA and comply,  DNA sample and $250 DNA surcharge.  Not possess/consume alcohol, not go upon premises for on site consumption.  Jail credit 1 day.  Eligible for Substance Abuse Program, Not eligible for Challenge Program.  Sentence to start forthwith.  Apply bond posted.  1:08pm/1:34pm
Status letter from Atty Schmeiser re: plea/sentencing  -  fax
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas J Meyers in court with attorney Sarah M Schmeiser on behalf of Atty Tracey Wood.    Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Partial agreement on motions.  Requested plea be set at later date at argued time.  Motion for offense to be 6th. Atty Sarah Schmeiser withdraws motion to suppress and no PSI is requested.  Parties to obtain plea/sentencing date.

Attorney Sarah Schmeiser appeared by phone; Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Withdraw is withdrawn; Attorney Wood will continue to represent.  June 7th motion hearing is next scheduled matter.
